citeinfo.title: Historical Annual First Bloom Index Anomaly, Contiguous United States, 1981-Previous Year
USA National Phenology Network, Gridded Data Product Suite

descript.abstract: Difference, in days, between the historical Extended Spring Index (SI-x) of First Bloom values for each year and the 30-year average for First Bloom Index values. The layers show how advanced or lagged the day of year of the leaf index is for the given year, compared to long-term average conditions, such that negative values represent locations that reached the SI-x requirements earlier than average, and positive values represent locations that reached the SI-x requirements later than average. The Extended Spring Indices are mathematical models that predict the "start of spring" (timing of leaf out or bloom for species active in early spring) at a particular location. These models were constructed using historical observations of the timing of first leaf and first bloom in a cloned lilac cultivar (S. x chinensis 'Red Rothomagensis') and two cloned honeysuckle cultivars (Lonicera tatarica 'Arnold Red' and L. korolkowii 'Zabelii'). Primary inputs to the model are temperature events, beginning January 1 of each year. Layers are available from each year beginning with 1981 until previous year. Input temperature data based on historical PRISM data at 4km resolution.
descript.purpose: The Extended Spring Indices have been used as an indicator of climate change by both the Environmental Protection Agency and the National Climate Assessment. The gridded forecast anomalies of first leaf and first bloom support understanding of spatial patterns in the timing of spring.

srcinfo.srccontr: Used as base climate data from which to calculate the Spring Index values.

procstep.procdesc: Download complete PRISM Tmax and Tmin datasets for 1980 - 2010.
For each year, 1981 - 2015, loop through the available PRISM data and calcuate the Spring Index values.
Spring Index anomaly values are calculated across the raster each day of the year comparing the above calculated Spring Index values and the 30-year average product.
After day 250 is complete, and the Spring Index anomaly values for the raster are no longer subject to change, then the final raster is archived as a data layer of this set.
